meanings.definition: A person who can understand spoken language by watching the movement of a speaker's lips.
meanings.sent1: Some lipreaders can easily follow conversations by focusing on the speaker's mouth.
meanings.sent2: The lipreaders in the class were able to comprehend the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent3: At the noisy party, the talented lipreader became the unofficial translator for the music-loving guests.
meanings.sent4: She was like a skilled lipreader, deciphering the unspoken emotions hidden behind his smile.
meanings.sent5: The lipreader's ability to decode words without sound amazed everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: The act of interpreting spoken language by observing the movements of a speaker's lips.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the lipreaders in the front row caught every word the actors said.
meanings.sent2: His skill in lipreading made him one of the best lipreaders in the community.
meanings.sent3: The detective used his lipreading talent to solve the mystery of the missing cake at the bakery.
meanings.sent4: In the silent movie, the heroine's lipreading ability saved the day when the sound system failed.
meanings.sent5: The lipreading class was full of eager students hoping to become expert lipreaders.
